Sample.Title: rna_wt_1_b1_s1

Channel.Treatment-Protocol: Cycloheximide was added to yeast media to final concentration 100µg/ml and growth was continued for 3 minutes then cells were harvested by filtration.
Channel.Growth-Protocol: The cells were grown in YPD (2% glucose, 2% peptone, 1% yeast extract) or SD (0,67% YNB w/o amino acids, 2% glucose) at 30C and 220 rpm to exponential growth stage.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Cells were resuspended in polysome lysis bufer (20 mM Tris pH 8.0, 140 mM KCl, 1.5 mM MgCl2, 100 g/ml cycloheximide, 1% Triton), flash frozen in liquid nitrogen and homogenyzed by grinding. Part of the cell lysates was used for mRNA isolation, another part was treated with ribonuclease I for polysome disassembly and applied to sucrose gradient fractionation with subsequent isolation of ribosome-bound RNA fragments from monosome fraction. mRNA was isolated using Oligo(dT) beads and ribosome-bound RNA was isolated using acidic-phenol extraction. cDNA libraries for Ribo-Seq and RNA-Seq were constructed in parallel using standard ribosomal profiling library construction protocol (described in Ingolia NT et al., 2009, Science).

Sample.Data-Processing: Reads were trimmed using cutadapt v. 2.10. 3’ adapter sequences for Ribo-Seq data: CTGTAGGCACCATCAATAGATCGGAAGAGCACACGTCTGAACTCCAGTCAC and RNA-Seq data: AGATCGGAAGAGCACACGTCTGAACTCCAGTCAC. Ribo-Seq reads were deduplicated with seqkit rmdup v. 0.10.1 by unique barcodes indexes. After barcode trimming, reads were aligned against eukaryotic rRNA sequences taken from silva-euk [10.1093/nar/gks1219] and rfam [10.1093/nar/gkaa1047] databases using bowtie2 v. 1.2.3 [10.1038/nmeth.1923]. Only unmapped reads were saved for further analysis. Read counting and mapping against the Saccharomyces_cerevisiae.R64-1-1.95 (Ensembl) genome assembly were obtained with STAR v. 2.7.9a Genome_build: Ensembl Saccharomyces_cerevisiae.R64-1-1.95 (genome-build-accession GCA_000146045.2) Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Tab-separated text files containing read counts per gene as estimated by STAR.

After barcode trimming, reads were aligned against eukaryotic rRNA sequences taken from silva-euk [10.1093/nar/gks1219] and rfam [10.1093/nar/gkaa1047] databases using bowtie2 v. 1.2.3 [10.1038/nmeth.1923]. Sample.Title: rna_stm1_3_b7_s1

Channel.Treatment-Protocol: Cycloheximide was added to yeast media to final concentration 100µg/ml and growth was continued for 3 minutes then cells were harvested by filtration.
Channel.Growth-Protocol: The cells were grown in YPD (2% glucose, 2% peptone, 1% yeast extract) or SD (0,67% YNB w/o amino acids, 2% glucose) at 30C and 220 rpm to exponential growth stage.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Cells were resuspended in polysome lysis bufer (20 mM Tris pH 8.0, 140 mM KCl, 1.5 mM MgCl2, 100 g/ml cycloheximide, 1% Triton), flash frozen in liquid nitrogen and homogenyzed by grinding. Part of the cell lysates was used for mRNA isolation, another part was treated with ribonuclease I for polysome disassembly and applied to sucrose gradient fractionation with subsequent isolation of ribosome-bound RNA fragments from monosome fraction. mRNA was isolated using Oligo(dT) beads and ribosome-bound RNA was isolated using acidic-phenol extraction. cDNA libraries for Ribo-Seq and RNA-Seq were constructed in parallel using standard ribosomal profiling library construction protocol (described in Ingolia NT et al., 2009, Science).

Channel.Treatment-Protocol: Cycloheximide was added to yeast media to final concentration 100µg/ml and growth was continued for 3 minutes then cells were harvested by filtration.
Channel.Growth-Protocol: The cells were grown in YPD (2% glucose, 2% peptone, 1% yeast extract) or SD (0,67% YNB w/o amino acids, 2% glucose) at 30C and 220 rpm to exponential growth stage.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Cells were resuspended in polysome lysis bufer (20 mM Tris pH 8.0, 140 mM KCl, 1.5 mM MgCl2, 100 g/ml cycloheximide, 1% Triton), flash frozen in liquid nitrogen and homogenyzed by grinding. Part of the cell lysates was used for mRNA isolation, another part was treated with ribonuclease I for polysome disassembly and applied to sucrose gradient fractionation with subsequent isolation of ribosome-bound RNA fragments from monosome fraction. mRNA was isolated using Oligo(dT) beads and ribosome-bound RNA was isolated using acidic-phenol extraction. cDNA libraries for Ribo-Seq and RNA-Seq were constructed in parallel using standard ribosomal profiling library construction protocol (described in Ingolia NT et al., 2009, Science).

Sample.Data-Processing: Library strategy: Ribo-seq Reads were trimmed using cutadapt v. 2.10. 3’ adapter sequences for Ribo-Seq data: CTGTAGGCACCATCAATAGATCGGAAGAGCACACGTCTGAACTCCAGTCAC and RNA-Seq data: AGATCGGAAGAGCACACGTCTGAACTCCAGTCAC. Ribo-Seq reads were deduplicated with seqkit rmdup v. 0.10.1 by unique barcodes indexes. After barcode trimming, reads were aligned against eukaryotic rRNA sequences taken from silva-euk [10.1093/nar/gks1219] and rfam [10.1093/nar/gkaa1047] databases using bowtie2 v. 1.2.3 [10.1038/nmeth.1923]. Only unmapped reads were saved for further analysis. Read counting and mapping against the Saccharomyces_cerevisiae.R64-1-1.95 (Ensembl) genome assembly were obtained with STAR v. 2.7.9a Genome_build: Ensembl Saccharomyces_cerevisiae.R64-1-1.95 (genome-build-accession GCA_000146045.2) Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Tab-separated text files containing read counts per gene as estimated by STAR.

Series.Title: RNA Sequencing and Ribosome profiling of TMA46, STM1 and YGR054W knockout yeast strains
Series.Summary: We present ribosome profiling and RNA-Seq data for the wild type BY4742 S. cerevisiae strain, and strains with the complete individual deletions of the TMA46, STM1 and YGR054W genes.
Series.Overall-Design: Yeast cells of 4 different S. cerevisiae strains, namely: wt, tma46Δ, eif2aΔ, stm1Δ were maintained in YPD media. The libraries were sequenced, resulting in 16 RNA-Seq and 16 Ribo-Seq data sets.
Series.Type: Expression profiling by high throughput sequencing
